summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The government provides notice of its intent to call an expert witness, Dr. [redacted], a clinical psychologist specializing in trauma, to testify about patterns of sexual abuse, grooming, and victim behavior. The letter also requests reciprocal discovery from the defense.

events.title: Government Expert Witness Disclosure
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a notice disclosing its intent to call a trauma psychology expert, Dr. [Redacted], to testify at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Government's Initial Discovery Request
events.description: The government had previously requested reciprocal discovery from the defense, a request which is reiterated in this letter.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
Alpert Medical School of Brown University
keyFacts: The government disclosed its intent to call an expert witness, a trauma psychologist, to testify about patterns of sexual abuse, grooming, and victim behavior in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

The expert's expected testimony includes that perpetrators target vulnerable individuals, abuse often involves manipulation/coercion rather than forcible rape, and grooming behaviors build trust to obscure abuse.
The expert is expected to testify that nondisclosure, incremental disclosure, and secrecy are common among victims, and that memory of trauma is impacted by surrounding circumstances.
The government explicitly states the expert has not evaluated any specific victim in the case and her testimony will be general, based on her clinical experience and research.
The letter reiterates the government's request for reciprocal discovery from the defense, including notice of any defense expert witnesses and related materials.
